curam.util.exception

Class SvrRemoteException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • curam.util.exception.SvrRemoteException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SvrRemoteException
extends java.lang.Exception
    This is the exception type thrown from Curam servers to remote clients. You do not normally construct instances of SvrRemoteException yourself. Instead, the Curam server automatically calls the toRemoteException method of any AppException that is thrown (and not handled) by server application code. This returns an exception instance that is returned to the calling client.
    See Also:
    AppException, AppException.toRemoteException(java.util.Locale), Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SvrRemoteException

        public SvrRemoteException(java.lang.String validationType,
                          java.lang.String fieldName,
                          java.lang.String remoteExceptionElement,
                          java.lang.String localisedExceptionString,
                          boolean containsRuntimeException)
        Construct a new with a single exception.
        Parameters:
        validationType - The type of validation failure.
        fieldName - The name of the field on which the exception occurred.
        remoteExceptionElement - The string version of the exception which should be added.
        localisedExceptionString - The localized version of the same exception which is typically returned to clients that cannot provide localizing
        containsRuntimeException - The flag indicating that the exception contains runtime exception.

      • SvrRemoteException

        public SvrRemoteException(int numberOfExceptions)
        Constructor. After calling this constructor the individual exceptions must be added.
        Parameters:
        numberOfExceptions - The number of exceptions that will be contained within this exception.

    • Method Detail

      • getExceptionDetails

        public java.lang.String[] getExceptionDetails()
        Obtain the string array containing the exception details. Each entry in the array reflects a different exception.
        Returns:
        The exception details for each of the exceptions. null is returned if there are no exceptions.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Obtain a single string containing the exception stored in the localisedException attribute. This interface would typically be used by a web service client. The locale of the exception message is the default locale used on the server and return value contains the reconstituted exception message as originally created on the server. The type, field name, message catalog and message identifier information is discarded from this string. Multi-message exceptions are not supported through this interface.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Throwable
        Returns:
        The message of the exception passed in through the constructor or null if the attribute is empty.

      • getNumberOfContainedExceptions

        public int getNumberOfContainedExceptions()
        Get the number of exceptions that are contained within this exception.
        Returns:
        The number of exceptions that are contained within this exception.

      • getExceptionDetails

        public java.lang.String getExceptionDetails(int index)
        Get the exception details for a specified exception.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the exception whose details should be obtained.
        Returns:
        message text in a string.

      • hasAppRuntimeException

        public boolean hasAppRuntimeException()
        Get a flag that indicates whether the exception contains runtime exception.
        Returns:
        true if the exception contains runtime exception.
